title: Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). 2. Mix 2 tablespoons butter and brown sugar together in a 9-inch round cake pan until blended; spread mixture to cover the bottom of the pan. Top with pineapple slices and place one cherry into the center of each slice. 3. Mix graham cracker crumbs, 3 tablespoons white sugar, and remaining 3 tablespoons melted butter in a bowl until combined. Press mixture over pineapple slices. 4. Beat cream cheese and ¾ cup white sugar in a bowl until blended. Add sour cream and vanilla; mix well. Add eggs one at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition until blended. Pour batter into the cake pan. 5. Bake until the center is almost set, 55 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from the oven. 6. Run a knife around the inside edge to loosen. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes. Invert onto a serving plate and refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving.
